name: @microfox/youtube-reporting-api
title: YouTube Reporting API
description: A TypeScript SDK for interacting with YouTube Reporting API. Supports listing report types, creating reporting jobs, listing jobs, listing available reports, and downloading reports.

readme_map.title: YouTube Reporting API
readme_map.description: The full README for the YouTube Reporting API

all_readmes.description: Initializes a new instance of the YouTubeReportingAPISDK.
Lists reports for a given job ID.
Downloads the report data from the provided URL.

constructors.name: YouTubeReportingAPISDK
constructors.description: Create a new YouTube Reporting API client through which you can interact with the API

internalKeys.description: The client ID for the Google OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The client secret for the Google OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The redirect URI for the Google OAuth 2.0 flow.
The access token for authenticated requests (optional).
The refresh token to obtain new access tokens (optional).
The scopes required for the YouTube Reporting API.

keysInfo.description: The client ID for the Google OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The client secret for the Google OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The redirect URI for the Google OAuth 2.0 flow.
The access token for authenticated requests (optional).
The refresh token to obtain new access tokens (optional).
The scopes required for the YouTube Reporting API.

extraInfo:
To use the YouTube Reporting API SDK, follow these steps:

1. Set up a Google Cloud project:
   - Go to the Google Cloud Console (https://console.cloud.google.com/)
   - Create a new project or select an existing one
   - Enable the YouTube Reporting API for your project

2. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials:
   - In the Google Cloud Console, go to "APIs & Services" > "Credentials"
   - Click "Create Credentials" and select "OAuth client ID"
   - Choose "Web application" as the application type
   - Set the authorized redirect URIs (include your application's callback URL)
   - Note down the Client ID and Client Secret

3. Set up environment variables:
   - GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID: Your OAuth 2.0 client ID
   - GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET: Your OAuth 2.0 client secret
   - GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI: Your authorized redirect URI
   - GOOGLE_ACCESS_TOKEN: (Optional) A valid access token
   - GOOGLE_REFRESH_TOKEN: (Optional) A valid refresh token

4. Install the SDK:
   ```
   npm install @yourusername/youtube-reporting-api-sdk
   ```

5. Import and initialize the SDK:
   ```typescript
   import { createYoutubeReportingAPISDK } from '@yourusername/youtube-reporting-api-sdk';

   const sdk = createYoutubeReportingAPISDK({
     clientId: process.env.GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID!,
     clientSecret: process.env.GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET!,
     redirectUri: process.env.GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI!,
     accessToken: process.env.GOOGLE_ACCESS_TOKEN,
     refreshToken: process.env.GOOGLE_REFRESH_TOKEN,
   });
   ```

6. Use the SDK methods to interact with the YouTube Reporting API:
   ```typescript
   // Example: List report types
   const reportTypes = await sdk.listReportTypes();
   console.log(reportTypes);
   ```

Important notes:
- Ensure you have the necessary OAuth 2.0 scopes: 
  - https://www.googleapis.com/auth/yt-analytics.readonly
  - https://www.googleapis.com/auth/yt-analytics-monetary.readonly
- The SDK handles token refresh automatically if a refresh token is provided
- Daily/backfill reports are available for 60 days, historical reports for 30 days
- Be aware of rate limits (consult the official API documentation for current limits)
- Handle errors appropriately, as network issues or API changes may occur

For more detailed information on available methods and their usage, refer to the SDK documentation and type definitions.
